content: Got it, I'm ready to start.
Hi there, and thank you for being here today! How are you feeling as we get started?
I guess I’m feeling a little skeptical, to be honest. I’ve never done this before and I’m not sure how it can help, but I’m here because I feel like I owe it to my partner and my family to try.

Thank you for sharing that. It takes courage to try something new, especially when you're not sure how it will help. It sounds like you’re here because you care deeply about your partner and family—that's no small thing. What do you hope we might talk about or explore today?

I guess I’d like to figure out why I can’t sleep lately. My mind just won’t shut off at night, and I keep thinking about work, about money, and how I’m going to provide for my family if things go wrong. Honestly, it’s exhausting.

That does sound exhausting—lying awake with all those thoughts racing through your mind. It seems like you’re carrying a lot on your shoulders, with work and providing for your family weighing heavily on you. What do you think might be contributing to these sleepless nights?

I think it's the stress from work, mostly. I keep worrying that I'll be one of the first to get laid off if things go south, especially since the stock market is looking bad. The idea of not being able to support my family scares me, and once I start thinking about it at night, I can’t seem to stop.

It sounds like there’s a lot of uncertainty at work right now, which brings fear about what the future might hold for you and your family. It must feel overwhelming to have so much worry about something that feels out of your control. How have you been coping with this stress during the day?

I don’t think I’m doing a great job of coping, honestly. I just push through the day, try to stay busy, and hope things will work out. But even when I’m not at work, I’m thinking about it, and it’s always there in the back of my mind.

It sounds like you’ve been carrying this stress with you all the time, even when you’re trying to stay busy or focus on other things. That’s a lot to hold onto by yourself. What has it been like to manage all of this on your own?
